Group:

I have attempted to install Cantera 1.5.4 (ver win32-py2.3) onto a
WinXP Pro SP2 machine.  I also am using Matlab 7.0.1 and Python 2.3.4
w/Numeric-23.6.

At this point, I am receiving "Cantera Error!" when I attempt to run
any of the demos.  I followed the Win installation directions and have
attempting several "fixes" to no success already.  

The error appears originate in the ct2ctml procedure.  The error
indicators from both programs are listed below.

Can anyone please offer any suggestion on how to address this error?

Thank you,
-tom


From Matlab---------Start Error---------------------

The system cannot find the path specified.
cmd /C c:/python23/python
C:\DOCUME~1\tps\LOCALS~1\Temp/.check1100822275.pyw>> log 2>&1
##################################################
######################
The Cantera Python interface is required in order to process
Cantera input files, but it does not seem to be correctly installed.
Check that you can invoke the Python interpreter with 
the command "python", and that typing "from Cantera import *"  
at the Python prompt does not produce an error. If Python on your
system
is invoked with some other command, set environment variable
PYTHON_CMD
to the full path to the Python interpreter. 
##################################################
#######################
??? 

************************************************
                Cantera Error!                  
************************************************


Procedure: ct2ctml
Error:   could not convert input file to CTML
